para.text: At the beginning of the work it makes sense to determine the format of the drawing.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The properties of a page are displayed in the properties panel on the right edge of the window if no other element is currently selected on the plan:

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Here you can set the page size and the page format.

para.text: names your page. This name also appears as text in the page tab-list below.

para.text: . This extended description appears as a tooltip on the page tab-list when the mouse is over it.

para.text: option you can define pages as placeholders. Sometimes it is important that the page numbers do not change when a new page is inserted. If you know this beforehand, you can insert reserved pages in advance. When printing, these reserved pages are simply skipped so that they do not use up paper unnecessarily.
